definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: His family were traders and used to travelling.
Rubei row feet, all take their eyes fall he taught Mo network, can not speak out.
sentences.chinese: 汝辈行脚，各须带眼，莫教堕落他网中，出头不得。

definition: to wander (typically of an errant priest)
to pass on doctrines from master to disciple (Buddhism)
(Buddhism) to initiate sb for monkhood or nunhood
to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
